sen.j: 令制国一覧 > 畿内> 山城国 > 紀伊郡
sen.e: List of provinces of Japan>Kinai region (provinces surrounding Kyoto and Nara) >Yamashiro Province>Kii County
List of provinces of Japan>Kinai region (provinces surrounding Kyoto and Nara) >Yamashiro Province>Kii County

sen.j: 紀伊郡（きいのこおり、きいぐん）は山城国・京都府にかつて存在した郡である。
sen.e: Kii County (or Kii-no-kori) was a country once existed in Yamashiro Province, in Kyoto Prefecture.
Kii-gun (or Kii-no-kori) was a county once existed in Yamashiro Province, in Kyoto Prefecture.
Kii-gun (or Kii-no-kori) was a county once existed in Yamashiro Province, in Kyoto Prefecture.
History
History
History
April 10, 1879
April 10, 1879
April 10, 1879

sen.j: - 郡区町村編制法に基づき伏見板橋二丁目（後の伏見町）に紀伊郡役所を設置。
sen.e: Based on Gun-ku-cho-son Henseiho (Act for the alignment of local government system), the Kii County public office was placed in 2, Fushimi Itabashi (later, Fushimi-cho).
Based on Gun-ku-cho-son Henseiho (Act for the alignment of local government system), the Kii County public office was placed in 2, Fushimi Itabashi (later, Fushimi-cho).
Based on Gun-ku-cho-son Henseiho (Act for the alignment of local government system), the Kii County public office was placed in 2, Fushimi Itabashi (later, Fushimi-cho).
April 1, 1889
April 1, 1889
April 1, 1889

sen.j: - 町村制施行に伴い、紀伊郡に伏見町・柳原町の2町と10村が成立する。
sen.e: According to the enforcement of municipal organization, two towns, i.e. Fushimi-cho and Yanagihara-cho, and ten villages were established in Kii County.
According to the enforcement of municipal organization, two towns, i.e. Fushimi-cho and Yanagihara-cho, and ten villages were established in Kii County.
According to the enforcement of municipal organization, two towns, i.e. Fushimi-cho and Yanagihara-cho, and ten villages were established in Kii County.
(two towns and ten villages)
(two towns and ten villages)
(two towns and ten villages)
April 1, 1918 (one town and nine villages)
April 1, 1918 (one town and nine villages)
April 1, 1918 (one town and nine villages)

sen.j: 柳原町、東九条村・上鳥羽村・深草村の一部が京都市下京区に編入。
sen.e: Yanagihara-cho, Higashikujo-mura, Kamitoba-mura and a part of Fukakusa-mura were incorporated into Shimogyo Ward, Kyoto City.
Yanagihara-cho, Higashikujo-mura, Kamitoba-mura and a part of Fukakusa-mura were incorporated into Shimogyo Ward, Kyoto City.
Yanagihara-cho, Higashikujo-mura, Kamitoba-mura and a part of Fukakusa-mura were incorporated into Shimogyo Ward, Kyoto City.

sen.j: 東九条村の残部が上鳥羽村に編入。
sen.e: The rest of Higashikujo-mura was incorporated into Kamitoba-mura.
The rest of Higashikujo-mura was incorporated into Kamitoba-mura.
The rest of Higashikujo-mura was incorporated into Kamitoba-mura.
October 1, 1922
October 1, 1922
October 1, 1922

sen.j: - 深草村が町制施行し深草町となる。
sen.e: Fukakusa-mura became Fukakusa-cho according to enforcement of municipal organization.
Fukakusa-mura became Fukakusa-cho according to enforcement of municipal organization.
Fukakusa-mura became Fukakusa-cho according to enforcement of municipal organization.
(two towns and eight villages)
(two towns and eight villages)
(two towns and eight villages)

sen.j: - 伏見町が市制施行し、伏見市となり郡より離脱。
sen.e: Fushimi-cho became Fushimi City according to the enforcement of municipal organization, seceding from the country.
Fushimi-cho became Fushimi City according to the enforcement of municipal organization, and seceded from the country.
Fushimi-cho became Fushimi City according to the enforcement of municipal organization, and seceded from the country.
(one town and eight villages)
(one town and eight villages)
(one town and eight villages)
April 1, 1931
April 1, 1931
April 1, 1931

sen.j: - 上鳥羽村・吉祥院村が京都市下京区（のち南区 (京都市)）に編入、深草町・下鳥羽村・横大路村・納所村・堀内村・向島村・竹田村が、伏見市、宇治郡醍醐村とともに京都市に編入し、伏見区が発足。
sen.e: Kamitoba-mura and Kisshoin-mura were incorporated into Shimogyo Ward, Kyoto City (later, Minami Ward [Kyoto City]), as well as Fukakusa-cho, Shimotoba-mura, Yokooji-mura, Nouso-mura, Horiuchi-mura, Mukaijima-mura, Takeda-mura, together with Fushimi City and Daigo-mura Uji-gun, were incorporated into Kyoto City, resulting in the inauguration of Fushimi Ward.

Kamitoba-mura and Kisshoin-mura were incorporated into Shimogyo Ward, Kyoto City (later, Minami Ward [Kyoto City]), as well as Fukakusa-cho, Shimotoba-mura, Yokooji-mura, Nouso-mura, Horiuchi-mura, Mukaijima-mura, Takeda-mura, together with Fushimi City and Daigo-mura Uji county, were incorporated into Kyoto City, resulting in the inauguration of Fushimi Ward.

Kamitoba-mura and Kisshoin-mura were incorporated into Shimogyo Ward, Kyoto City (later, Minami Ward [Kyoto City]), as well as Fukakusa-cho, Shimotoba-mura, Yokooji-mura, Nouso-mura, Horiuchi-mura, Mukaijima-mura, Takeda-mura, together with Fushimi City and Daigo-mura Uji county, were incorporated into Kyoto City, resulting in the inauguration of Fushimi Ward.
Kii County disappeared at the same time.
Kii County disappeared at the same time.
Kii County disappeared at the same time.

sen.j: 和名類聚抄に見える郡内の8郷。
sen.e: Wamyoruiju-sho (Kango-Japanese Dictionary) described the following eight villages (go)in this country.

sen.j: 延喜式神名帳には、山城国紀伊郡に以下の大社3座・小社5座の計8座が記載されている。
sen.e: Engishiki jimmyocho (a register of shrines in Japan) described the following total of eight shrines consisting of three large shrines and five small shrines in Yamashiro Province, Kii County.
